Description: Limestone ostracon: on recto and verso respectively seven and six lines of a continuous magical text, some sentences of which are nearly identical with Pleyte and Rossi, 'Papyrus de Turin', 136, 9—11. The last line on the verso contains a date in red ink.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: J. J. Černy and A.H. Gardiner, ‘Hieratic Ostraca’ (Oxford 1957), p. 12 and pl. 41, 2.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393761) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393761)
